page.title: 07Braintree Centre Facilities
page.content: The centre of Braintree and Bocking is a mixture of the old town with a new growth planned by the council. However as much of our history is in this small area we cannot abandon whole areas to the concrete jungle. The area around Bank Street is a rabbit warren of passages and alleys each turning revealing a new face to old Braintree. One question to which we cannot find an answer is the provision of toilets in the centre of the town. There are only two sets of public conveniences, one on either side of the main shopping centre. During our interviews with the older residents of the area many asked why there could not be more provision made. These older inhabitants also would have enjoyed a greater number of seats in the pedestrianised areas.
